com.link_intersystems.lang.ref

Interface Reference<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the reference object's referent type.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MutableReference<T>, ObservableReference<T>, SerializableReference<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSerializableReference, CopyOnAccessReference, DefaultMutableReference, HardReference, NullReference, NullSafeReference, ObservableReferenceAdapter, SerializableObjectReference, ThreadLocalReference

    public interface Reference<T>
    Represents a reference to an object. In contrast to the Reference provided by standard java, this reference is intended to be implemented by clients. Every time you need an indirect reference to another object (lazy loading,etc.) a Reference is the simplest way to implement this. The return value of get() should never be cached by a client. Instead the client should call get() whenever it needs a referent and clients must be prepared to handle referent changes.
    Since:
    1.0.0;
    Version:
    1.2.0;
    Author:
    Ren√© Link [rene.link@link- intersystems.com]
